result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Ray Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail sentence WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES if employed may be served in Pierce, Pepin, St Croix, Dunn or Polk County
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE TO JAIL SENTENCE IN 13CF22

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Ray Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Ray Larson in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Michael Ray Larson in custody.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: files an amended information; amending Ct#1 to a misdm. 10 days jail consecutive to jail time in 13CF22. Hargrove and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to amended charge; Hargrove stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of amended charge. Hargrove address sentencing. Def addresses court. Court orders 10 days in the PCJ consecutive to his sentence in 13CF22; huber is allowed if Def gets employment. appeal rights given to def.
Plea hearing on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Def pleas not guilty to charge. Court: Def did not sign signature bond. If Def signs bond; reminds Def of bond conditions. See JA for next hearing.

11:39 Defendant Michael Ray Larson in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Michael Ray Larson in custody.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over Preliminary Hearing and Questionnaire Waiver with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court: accepts the waiver as voluntarily waived. finds the Def probably committed a felony. binds Def over for trial.Thorie files information; giving Def a copy. Court reads charges and maximum penalties. Def waives further reading.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2014 at 11:30 am.

3:43  Defendant Michael Ray Larson in court via video conferencing, in custody.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone with Def.  Defendant does not have a  copy of complaint. 3:46 A copy of criminal complaint is faxed to Jail. 3:48 Def was handed a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court reads charges and penalties and charging portion of complaint.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie requests $5000 signature bond. No objection by Nelson. Court orders a $5000 signature bond. Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Def has not been in any branch of the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 11:30 am.
